page.title: 04Hellifield Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council consists of seven members elected by the villagers every four years. The Chairman is elected by the Councillors annually. The earliest records of meetings of the Council go back to 1908. Meetings take place in the Village Institute on the first Tuesday in the month at 7.30pm. The first half hour is put aside to allow villagers to ask questions, make requests, offer suggestions, and to put complaints. The Council is responsible for the allotments, playing areas, street lighting and the tidiness of the village. A present project is to finance an improvement in street lighting at an estimated cost of Â£10,000 to Â£13,000. A proposal to bipass the village at some future date is on display in the Post Office.
